node.title: Julianne Boyd to Retire After 27 Years at Barrington Stage
node.alt: “I’ve been thinking about retiring for a few years, but I couldn’t do it during Covid,” said Julianne Boyd, the artistic director of Barrington Stage Company. “I want some free time.”
node.description: Under her leadership, the nonprofit produced “The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee” and other shows that made it to Broadway.
node.content: ["Julianne Boyd, who has served as artistic director of Barrington Stage Company since cofounding the Western Massachusetts nonprofit in 1995, will retire next fall.", "The company started by renting space at a high school in Sheffield, Mass., and now operates five buildings in Pittsfield, Mass. It has had a number of notable successes, the best known of which is \u201cThe 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee,\u201d a musical by William Finn and Rachel Sheinkin, which Barrington first staged in that high school\u2019s cafeteria in 2004. The next year, the musical transferred, first to Off Broadway\u2019s Second Stage Theater, and then to Broadway, and it has repeatedly been staged around the world.", "Barrington Stage, one of the many arts institutions that have made the Berkshires a destination for culture lovers, also developed a revival of \u201cOn the Town\u201d that transferred to Broadway in 2014, and a new play, \u201cAmerican Son,\u201d that opened on Broadway (starring Kerry Washington and Steven Pasquale) in 2018.", "Boyd, 76, said that after one last summer season she will be ready for a new chapter. She said she plans to continue to split her time between Pittsfield and New York, to direct, and to spend time with her seven grandchildren. \u201cNana hasn\u2019t been there,\u201d she said.", "The last two summers have been particularly challenging because of the coronavirus pandemic. Last year, after stages had shuttered nationwide, Boyd directed the country\u2019s first play featuring an Equity actor during the pandemic \u2014 an outdoor production of \u201cHarry Clarke.\u201d", "\u201cI\u2019ve been thinking about retiring for a few years, but I couldn\u2019t do it during Covid,\u201d she said. \u201cI want some free time, and I don\u2019t want the day-to-day responsibilities to be on me.\u201d", "The theater company has produced a lot of new work \u2014 41 premieres \u2014 including two small plays, \u201cFreud\u2019s Last Session\u201d and \u201cBecoming Dr. Ruth,\u201d both by Mark St. Germain, that have gone on to be staged by many other regional theaters.", "And last weekend, the theater wrapped up another noteworthy endeavor: a nine-performance presentation of a musical in development, \u201cMr. Saturday Night,\u201d adapted from the 1992 film and starring Billy Crystal, who is also one of the show\u2019s three writers.", "The theater, which has an annual budget of $5.2 million and a year-round staff of 22, will conduct a search for Boyd\u2019s replacement.", "Boyd\u2019s retirement, announced Wednesday, is the second departure news from a major Berkshire theater company this week. On Monday, the Williamstown Theater Festival said that its artistic director, Mandy Greenfield, had stepped down."]
